page.title: 08Great Priory Farm.
page.content: The farm is owned by the three daughters of{John Tabor}of{Bovingdon {Hall.}It is farmed in conjunction with the{Tabor Estate. On the land is the site of the {Priory.}Hopefully, one day the site will be excavated but the{County {Archeologists}are busy investigating sites threatened by new building. We were surprised to hear that there is no legal protection for the site. However the bumpy surface is a good safeguard against the plough. There are two thatched barns, from the 13th and 17th centuries. Both need re-thatching and grant aid may be available for the older one. The cost is estimated at about Â£19,000. There is also a 16th cent. granary. In the newer barn,{Lucy Tabor's}husband,{John {Gray}is making furniture. This small family business is known as{Craftsman.
